classes.cCustomNote:
Choose one of the following: ES112, ISLA123, RELS201, or WGS201.

ES112 and WGS201 satisfy GE Area D1 and USCP. RELS201 satisfies GE Area D2. Taking one of these options will increase Free Electives unit requirement.

Any Free Elective course can go here.

Some GE requirements may be met by course selections within the emphasis; in that case, additional free electives may be required to reach a total of 180 units. If upper-division GE courses are used to satisfy emphasis area requirements, additional upper-division coursework may be required to satisfy the University's 60-units upper-division requirement.
Choose one of the following: HIST213, or SOC218.

One course from each of the following GE areas must be completed: A1, A2, A3, B1, B2, B4, Upper-Division B, C1, C2, Lower-Division C Elective, D1, Upper-Division D, E, F, and GE Elective (two courses). Upper-Division B and Upper-Division D should be taken only after Junior standing is reached (90 units). Refer to the online catalog for GE course selection, United States Cultural Pluralism (USCP), and Graduation Writing Requirement (GWR). The USCP requirement can be satisfied by some (but not all) courses within GE categories: C1, Upper-Division C, D1, Area D Elective, Upper-Division D, or E.

One course from each of the following GE areas must be completed: A1, A2, A3, B1, B2, B4, Upper-Division B, C1, C2, Lower-Division C Elective, D1, Upper-Division D, E, F, and GE Elective (two courses). Upper-Division B and Upper-Division D should be taken only after Junior standing is reached (90 units). Refer to the online catalog for GE course selection, United States Cultural Pluralism (USCP), and Graduation Writing Requirement (GWR). The USCP requirement can be satisfied by some (but not all) courses within GE categories: C1, Upper-Division C, D1, Area D Elective, Upper-Division D, or E.

Choose one of the following: STAT130, STAT217, STAT218, or STAT312.

STAT130, STAT217, and STAT218 satisfy GE Area B4. STAT312 satisfies GE Area B Upper-Division.

Select one concentration in the catalog and choose courses in consultation with an advisor. Courses must be from at least two different disciplines, and no more than half of courses taken in the concentration can have the same prefix. Courses cannot be used to meet other major requirements. See catalog for additional details.

Students can attempt to fulfill the requirement after 90 earned units; students should complete the requirement before senior year. Any GWR course or GWR exam can go here. Refer to the current catalog for prerequisites.
